link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
formula: E.g.f. for the n-th subdiagonal: exp(x)*P(n,x), where P(n,x) is the polynomial Sum_{k = 0..n} binomial(n,k)*(-2*x)^k/k!. For example, the e.g.f. for the second subdiagonal is exp(x)*(1 - 4*x + 4*x^2/2) = 1 - 3*x - 3*x^2/2! + x^3/3! + 9*x^4/4! + 21*x^5/5! + .... - _Peter Bala_, Mar 05 2017
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := Sum[Binomial[n - j, k]*Binomial[k, j]*(-3)^j, {j, 0, n}]; Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 15 2017 *)
program: (PARI) for(n=0,10, for(k=0,n, print1(sum(j=0,n, binomial(n-j,k)*  binomial(k,j)*(-3)^j), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 15 2017
